Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Right Stuff" and "American Dreamz".

"The Right Stuff", released in 1983, is a biographical film about the United States Space Program's selection of the Mercury 7 astronauts in the early 1960s. The film stars Richard Dreyfuss as President John F. Kennedy, Willard Scott as NASA Administrator Robert C. Seamans, and Buzz Aldrin as Apollo 13 Mission Commander.

"American Dreamz", released in 2006, is an American musical romantic drama film directed by Baz Luhrmann. The film stars Ryan Gosling, Emma Stone, Tom Hardy, John Travolta, Penelope Cruz, Jeremy Irons, and others.

In summary, "The Right Stuff" provides insight into the early years of NASA and the Mercury 7 astronauts. On the other hand, "American Dreamz" is a musical romantic drama film directed by Baz Luhrmann.
